intro: Tilia miyabei, commonly known as the Japanese lime tree, is a deciduous tree native to Japan. It belongs to the Tiliaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by round, smooth fruits. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and thrives in well-drained soils. The bark is smooth and light gray, becoming fissured with age.
